dt.t: The Washington National Cathedral mourners filled the building with the song, {ldquo}… Praise Him, praise Him, {wi}alleluia{/wi}!{rdquo}
In Britain it was not yet compulsory to agree with your leader. {wi}Alleluia{/wi} to that.

et: Middle English, from Late Latin, from Greek {it}allēlouia{/it}, from Hebrew {it}halălūyāh{/it} praise ye Jehovah

dt.t: The entire season is marked by quiet restraint. Bold colors are removed from altars. Liturgical {wi}alleluias{/wi} are left unsaid.
In this cantata, it [the chorale] leads directly into the concluding {wi}Alleluia{/wi}.
